Posts.Content: lmrunner wrote: I had a mastectomy on Oct 29th and had my first visit with the oncologist on Nov 10th.  Because I had invasive cancer, the tumors were over 2 cm, and I am considered pre-menopausal (have still had periods within the last year), he is recommending chemotherapy.  But my lymph nodes came back clear, and my husband is questioning whether I should put myself thru chemo if the benefits don't outweigh the risks.  I am waiting for the results of a test called Oncotype Dx, and I think I will base my decision on this test.  But does anyone else have any thoughts, advice, websites, etc that could help?  I am really struggling with this decision .  Dx 9/12/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIA, Grade 1, 0/2 nodes, ER+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2008 12:33AM lmrunner wrote: I agree with Dawn - you should have a choice with everything.  I feel like I've been given a choice thru the whole process - mastectomy or lumpectomy, implant or tram, chemo or not.  Of course, there are limits.  I chose mastectomy because it was in multiple sites, and I'm smaller.  If they tried to get it thru lumpectomy, I would not have had much left.  And I would have always wondered if they got it all.  But I've done research on everything and I ask so many questions, I think I drive the doctors crazy.  But I want to know everything before I make a decision.  The mastectomy decision is one I feel good about, as is the expander/implant decision.  I'm just struggling now with the chemo decision.  I think I'm going to let the oncotype score make the decision for me.

Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2008 08:48AM lmrunner wrote: Hi Dawn, I had a mastectomy with the expander as well.  I have not had an expansion done yet, but am going for my first one this week.  Is that painful?  I am nervous about that too.  But the chemo decision is really weighing heavy on my mind.  I'm 48, and my sister (younger) went thru this same thing a year ago.  Maybe the family link has something to do with their recommendation.  But I saw my sister go thru a hard time with the chemo.  I'm not sure I want to do that if it's not necessary.  I hope the oncotype score comes back low.  Linda

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2008 02:15PM lmrunner wrote: Hi all, I guess I can join this group.  I had my surgery on Oct 29th and am now home recuperating.  I had a mastectomy with sentinel node biopsy & an expander.  My nodes were clear, so they only ended up taking 2 of them.  I think the most painful thing for me is the expander.  My whole chest feels like a big charley horse - it gets so tight and painful.  Also, sleeping is really hard.  I still can't lay down and end up sleeping sitting up, which is very uncomfortable.  My plastic surgeon had said I would go home with a pain pump, but I never got one.  Just vicodin and darvocet.  They helped a lot the first few days, but I really don't like how tired they make me feel.  I'm just taking them at night now.  I have one drain, and I wish I could get the darn thing out.  I feel bad for all of you who have more than this.  What a pain in the drain!  I have an appt on Monday with the oncologist.  This is my biggest fear.  I really don't want to go thru chemo.  The surgery is one thing, but I was hoping since my genetic test came back negative and that my nodes were clear, that they would say I didn't need chemo.  But no.  Since I'm still in my 40's and had 2 sites over 2 cm that were cancerous (1 DCIS and 1 IDC), I'm now hearing chemo is in store for me.
